title: Tutorial de Puredata em Inglês 3.1
description: Tutorial original por Alexandre Porres - Adaptação para WebPD por Guilherme Lunhani

en.name: Conversion
en.description: Convert PureData patchs to markdown files. You can have it [here](https://sites.google.com/site/porres/pd). The work is to separate patches in snippets: the comments will be changed to Markdown format texts, and chunks of codes will be new patches. The patches source is [here](https://www.github.com/jahpd/gitbook-plugin-webpd_porres_examples) as separated project, and modify them will modify examples in this book.

en.name: Conversion 2
en.description: Gitbook can export a webpage to a printable version. Thinking on this, runnable patchs need a special treatment. (1) Responsive website (you can read this on Android or iOS tablet); (2) in a printable version (pdf, mobi, etc), runnable patches don't work (it's obivious that gitbook don't print [paper speakers](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y1F5Gg4bG3o), but someone can hack this...), so is necessary that only SVG representations will be added on `<script>`s.

en.name: Translation
en.description: We think that multilanguage tutorial is a good approach. If you do not know anything about PD, but know some other language other than english, you will be welcome.

en.name: Improve [gitbook-plugin-webpd](https://www.github.com/jahpd/gitbook-plugin-webpd) library
en.description: This is the core of book; uses [WebPD](https://github.com/sebpiq/WebPd) to render PD patchs. The current development only render SVG versions of GUI side. We need help to execute audio examples. Here is the [source](https://www.github.com/jahpd/gitbook-plugin-webpd)

changelog.description: fixed bugs that won't show patches
